Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add Make Agenda feature to Agent Builder

Add a "Make Agenda" button that generates a follow-up meeting agenda
based on the current meeting analysis. The agenda includes action item
review, time allocations, and preparation notes.

- Add Make Agenda button to action buttons row with loading spinner
- Add collapsible "Next Meeting Agenda" result card
- Implement generateAgenda\(\) function using GPT-5.2
- Add agendaSystem prompt for structured agenda generation
- Reset agenda section on new analysis

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Implement Societies of Thought \(SoT\) for diverse cognitive perspectives

Based on "Reasoning Models Generate Societies of Thought" \(arXiv:2601.10825\),
this adds multi-perspective analysis to the RLM pipeline:

Phase 0: Agent Builder extracts SoT metadata \(meetingType, keyEntities,
  topicTags, contentSignals, suggestedPerspective\) during analysis

Phase 1: New perspective-roles.js module defines 7 cognitive roles
  \(analyst, advocate, critic, synthesizer, historian, pragmatist, stakeholder\)

Phase 1.5: Query decomposer assigns perspectives to agents/groups and
  generates role-aware sub-queries

Phase 2: New conflict-detector.js identifies tensions between perspectives;
  aggregator surfaces conflicts in synthesis prompts

Phase 3: context-store.js adds queryAgentsWithDiversity\(\) for diversity-
  weighted agent selection across sourceType, meetingType, temporalQuarter

Phase 4: sub-executor.js adds MAP->DEBATE->REDUCE strategy that pits
  opposing perspectives \(advocate vs critic, etc.\) before synthesis

Phase 5: CSS styles for perspective badges and conflict summary UI;
  orchestrator renders conflict analysis in chat responses

Phase 6: Settings toggles for enableSocietiesOfThought, enableConflictDetection,
  enableDebatePhase, enableDiversitySelection

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
